author: sussman
msg: Issue #742: fix commits of replaced files that have props.
Really, this a collection of logic fixes for property-handling when
replacing files.
* props.c (svn_wc_props_modified_p): for schedule==replace or add, the
mere existence of working props signifies local mods or not; base
props are ignored.
* svn_wc.h (svn_wc_transmit_prop_deltas):  take an entry instead of an
svn_node_kind.
* adm_crawler.c (svn_wc_transmit_prop_deltas):  for schedule==replace
or add, use an empty base-prop hash for deriving propchanges.
* commit_util.c (do_item_commit): pass an entry into transmit_prop_deltas.
* log.c (log_do_committed): if file was replaced in commit, be sure to
delete any leftover, crufty base-prop file when we start our
post-commit property processing.
* prop_tests.py (commit_replacement_props): new regression test.

author: kfogel
msg: Resolve issue #769:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(revert_admin_things): Handle case where base props file exists but
working props file does not.  Also rename `pthing' to `base_thing',
because I kept getting confused and thinking it was "parent thing".

author: sussman
msg: Issue #734:  tighten the behavior of 'svn cp URL URL'.
For now, don't allow this command to overwrite anything.  We can
change this behavior later if we want.
* copy.c
(repos_to_repos_copy): when checking the dst-URL's existence,
prevent a directory overwrite.  no need to check for a pre-existing
file; the RA layers' out-of-dateness checks will prevent file
overwrites for us.
* copy_tests.py
(no_copy_overwrites): new copy test to check this behavior.

author: kfogel
msg: Resolve issue #755 by fixing the remaining notification buglets:
* subversion/libsvn_client/repos_diff.c
(close_file): Distinguish between adds and updates in the
notification action.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(open_root): If this is a checkout, pass the `added' flag when
constructing the root dir baton.

author: kfogel
msg: * notes/xslt/svnindex.xsl: Change wrong "header" element to
"head".
Suggested by: Daniele Nicolodi <daniele@grinta.net>
